com.se.simplicity.picking.engine
Interface PickingEngine

All Superinterfaces:
Engine, java.lang.Runnable
public interface PickingEngine
extends Engine

Manages the picking of a SceneGraph. Each advance processes the outstanding Picks, the results are fired to any PickListeners in the form of a PickEvent.

Author:
Gary Buyn

pick

void pick(float x,
          float y,
          float width,
          float height)

Registers a pick at the given location and area relative to this PickingEngine's Camera in SceneGraph coordinates.

Parameters:
x - The position on the x axis to pick.
y - The position on the y axis to pick.
width - The width of the area to pick.
height - The height of the area to pick.

pick

Registers a pick at the given location and area relative to this PickingEngine's Camera in SceneGraph coordinates.

Parameters:
pick - The position and area to pick.

pickViewport

void pickViewport(Viewport viewport,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height)

Registers a pick at the given location of a Viewport with the given dimensions.

Parameters:
viewport - The Viewport to pick.
x - The position on the x axis of the Viewport to pick.
y - The position on the y axis of the Viewport to pick.
width - The width of the area on the Viewport to pick.
height - The height of the area on the Viewport to pick.

pickViewport

void pickViewport(Viewport viewport,
                  Pick pick)

Registers a pick at the given location and area of a Viewport.

Parameters:
viewport - The Viewport to pick.
pick - The position and area of the Viewport to pick.

removePickListener

void removePickListener(PickListener listener)

Removes a PickListener from those to be invoked when a SceneGraph is picked.

Parameters:
listener - A PickListener that was to be invoked when a SceneGraph is picked.

setCamera

void setCamera(Camera camera)

Sets the viewpoint that will be adapted to create the picking viewpoint.

Parameters:
camera - The viewpoint that will be adapted to create the picking viewpoint. The Camera given will not be modified when creating the picking viewpoint.
